urlLink The Sacrifice For Freedom I'm a soldier creeping forward only thinking of my brother I would rather kill myself then leaving him only with my mother. I left the base with my partner, creeping side by side. Then we were attacked, my partner had just died. Shot with a machine gun, the bullets pierced his head. He didn't feel a thing, but you could tell that he was dead. I wish to hell that he had screamed, but all that he could say was something I will not forget, not until my dying day. He said, tell my folks I'm sorry for joining the army; but even though I will be dead, tell them not to be sorry. For I'm the one who joined, not cramps nor ma or day. Just tell them I'll see them in heaven. I'll be waiting for them all. Then he let me go, leaving with a final gasp. I cried and cried and screamed for help, but the enemy only laughed. They took my friend and buried his corpse, leaving themselves to boast. He gave his life and so did I, now that's what freedom costs. By Jerome Dixon Copyright 2001

Those Willing To Fight In these past few days and in the weeks ahead, much has happened, there will be more I dread. I know deep in the very depths of my soul, what we do is something righteous and bold. Freedom you see, not a God given right, But something given to us all by those willing to fight. Soldiers, Sailors, Marines and Airmen alike, whose blood was shed for our constitutional rights! Some fought right here to form the USA. Some fought and died in lands far away! One thing remains true, even today, as our men and women fight. They are protecting freedom. They are protecting our lives. It's not just freedom for you and me. It's freedom for all in the world, don't you see? 9/11 took more than just American lives, it touched thousands of lives in the world, that's why we fight! To stop the evil that lurks about, we vowed to find them all and root them out!! So please stand strong and try to unite! You don't have to agree with this war that we fight. Just think of the freedom's each day you enjoy, and then of the families with loved ones deployed. They are all fighting to keep this world free, from terrorist and ALL that support them. Can't you see! Pray that we are successful in our fight, and that the Iraqi people will be freed from their terrible plight. So I will as again, think, please before you speak. The word you say can cause great grief! To those Soldiers, Sailors, Marines, and Airmen alike. Your words tear at the hearts of those willing to fight. It insults their families and disrespects all they sacrifice! Please don't forget why we are free. Respect the flag, display her for all to see! One nation under God, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all! Don't you remember those words, have you forgotten them all? To all of those willing to fight, God Bless you for your courage and sacrifice! By Andrea M. Paterson Copyright 2003 urlLink

Thank You Troops A question sir I pray to ask Whatever enticed you to this task? Please sir, why such a difficult task? Good things my lad are hard to attain and freedom son comes with a stain This life I entered young and brave now I'm old and headed for the grave. But regret never will I it's reward enough to see our flag fly A plea I have for all remember those who heeded the call See the flag up yonder? That's why I was willing to wander. The tears are flowing down my cheeks I try but I can not speak A message now I'll write or I shan't sleep tonight. A debt of thanks to you I owe and I long to tell you so. May heaven bless you each and every day Guide and protect you all the way. By Jenny game Copyright 2004 urlLink

A little over a year ago I started sending care packages to a U.S. Marine I adopted. I adopted him through GySgt Lassiter who were both stationed at Camp Fox, Kuwait. Cpl Guerrerolopez or know to his fellow Marines as Cpl G-Lo . After returning home from his first tour in Operation Iraqi Freedom Cpl G-Lo came to my house. I got a chance to meet him in person, I was able to shake his hand & thank him. Thank him for doing a job I could not do. Cpl G-Lo will never know how much I appreciate him going out of his way to visit me at home. In my opion I did nothing that important but send care packages, supplies & letter of support. Cpl G-lo & GySgt Lassiter along with all my adopted have done more for me then I can ever do for them. They are able to stand on alone & defend the freedoms are great nation provide. I THANK YOU Cpl G-lo !! I'm honored to support you ! I feel privledge to be able to send you care packages & support letters. Thank you for staying in touch as long as you have sir.
